title: [QUESTION] SKBitmap from byte array

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body:
I can't give you a full example right now. Pls have a look at this https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/skiasharp.skbitmap.decode?view=skiasharp-1.68.0
You should be able to load your Bitmap that way if the codec is supported.

comments.author: wario2k
comments.body:
Like @Gillibald mentioned you could just use Decode, the documentation is pretty extensive and it seems to be a good means of getting it done. 
The snippet below is an example of loading a bitmap from an image stream. 

`var backgroundBitmap = SKBitmap.Decode(imageFileStream);`

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Closing this due to lack of updates.

Bitmaps and images can be created using raw pixel data or encoded data. Both are supported in SkiaSharp.
